text: Beth David Cemetery is a Jewish cemetery located at 300 Elmont Road in Elmont, New York. The cemetery was established in 1917. As of 2012, there were approximately 245,000 burials in the cemetery. ==Notable interments== *Eduard Bloch (1872-1945), personal physician to the family of Adolf Hitler *Rube Bloom (1902-1976), musician *Joyce Brothers (1927-2013), psychologist *Bernard Herrmann (1911-1975), composer *Sol Kaplan (1919-1990), composer *Andy Kaufman (1949-1984), comedian and actor *Martin Landau (1928-2017), actor *Sam Levenson (1911-1980), humorist *Chuck Low (1928-2017), actor *Sidney Lumet (1924-2011), film director *Jack Newfield (1938-2004), journalist *Doc Pomus (1925-1991), musician *Saul Rogovin (1923-1995), baseball player *Benjamin Stanley Rosenthal (1923-1983), politician *Walt Singer (1911-1992), football player *Harry Strauss (1909-1941), mobster *Herbert Tenzer (1905-1993), politician *Abe Vigoda (1921-2016), actor *Herman Wouk (1915-2019), author ==References== Category:Cemeteries in New York (state) Category:Cemeteries in Nassau County, New York Category:Jewish cemeteries in New York (state) Category:Jews and Judaism in Suffolk County, New York
title: Beth David Cemetery
